Posts.Content: OkiePat wrote: I am new to LE.  I was just diagnosed on March 26th.  I finally got my sleeve & glove Friday afternoon.  I had no problems wearing them.  I did have some swelling in my hand.  The swelling went down overnight.  Today my little finger went numb as the day went I was driving home from work and all five fingers went numb.  I took the glove off and it went away.  I left it off for about 2 hours.  I then put it back on and now it is doing the same.  Is my glove too tight, or too small.  When I was fitted my arm etc. has not changed.   When she put it on me at first my fingers turned red, but not blue.  She said to wait till Monday and if they are still red to call.  There not red but they are getting numb.  Is it that I'm not moving my hand enough.  I have soo many questions.  I have been reading on the board for some time.   Thanks for any help.    Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Glove Problem OkiePat marlegal

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2008 09:24AM OkiePat wrote: Thanks Sushanna and Binney for your help.  The swelling was before I got my glove and sleeve.  I had done some cleaning around the house and I think the chemicals caused my hand to swell.  I will be wearing gloves from now on. I do not wear them at night.  I sleep with a pillow so my arm and hand is resting hopefully to keep swelling down at night. I thought that I would wear the glove till it starts to bother me and take it off for a while.  I understand totally about nothing being normal again.  I started this complete journey 2 1/2 years ago and I have not had normal since.  I take one day at a time and look forward for the next day. Thanks again. Pat

Posts.Content: OkiePat wrote: I don't know how concerned I should be. I have had two wasp/hornet (not sure which) stings on my right side. This is my main surgery side with 17 nodes removed. It stung me on the side of my head right above my ear toward the back and also stung me on the neck about middle of the leader that goes to the base of your neck. The one on my neck is pretty sore and I'm thinking because of it being on the leader. I panic when anything happens on that side because of lymphedema. I have been so careful so far and now this. I washed the area with anitbactiral soap and then put hydrocordizone on it. Then after the pain slowed down I took a shower and put some solarcaine on it. I have never been alergic to insect bites so I'm not really worried about that. Sorry to be so long, but I am concerned that it being on the same side and close to where the nodes were taken. I know there are some in my neck as well, but will they take care of the venom that the little devil decided I needed. Log in to post a reply
